CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 13, 1946, pg. 4, reads: "Does The Jail Have Vacancies? - Mrs. Hattie Dodson, age 76, and daughter Mrs. Mary Davenport, point to the Health Department [illegible] ordering them to move from their condemned home on Humber Way.  Neither Mrs. Dodson or her daughter are able to work and say [ill.] can't find a house. They were arrested by Centre Avenue police [ill.] Health Department information.  Magistrate Robert "Pappy" Williams released the women until April 15. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Hattie Dodson and daughter Mary Davenport, standing on steps of their house with sign from Health Department to Vacate Premises, 2325 Mahon Street and Humber Way, Hill District
